snippet.title: Mega Drive Longplay [303] Skeleton Krew
snippet.description:
http://www.longplays.org

Played by: Mad-Matt

Skeleton Krew, developed by Core Design and published by Front Street publishing in 1995.

"Wanna pack a BIG GUN with enough ammo to level a city? You got it...! Wanna massakre seriously psykotic Psykogenix mutants and get paid? You got it...! Wanna blast your way through the savage secret zones, deadly Krewtraps, mad n' bad buildings and hideous end-of-level Psykos comprising 6 HUMUNGOUS LEVELS of 3D isometrik karnage - and wear a spectacularly sexy, hyper-hi-tek, Big Ordanance Neutralising Exo-skeleton, to boot? Well you got it all - but only if you join Spine, Joint and Rib, otherwise known as the SKELETON KREW, in their first outRAGEous blastfest!!"

The game starts out promising with level one, and follows suit with an arena styled level 2. However level 3 on-wards becomes a pretty lack luster affair although I guess level 5 is ok.

I found the game more difficult than it should have been particularly due to the strange controls in this game. You will see me move in odd ways through this play through as I never quite get a hang of it. I let the game open in its demo mode showing all 3 selectable characters before starting.

00:00:00 - Character Intros
00:04:05 - Level 1 (Monstrocity)
00:10:10 - Level 2 (Elevator Shaft)
00:16:10 - Level 3 (Sewer Duct)
00:24:40 - Level 4 (Mars)
00:29:55 - Level 5 (Venus)
00:39:50 - Level 6 (Kadavers Base)

00:50:24 - Alternate Ending (Bad Choice)
